headline: Data Engineer |  AWS  | Azure | Spark | Kafka | Airflow | Snowflake | Data bricks| python
about:
I am a Data Engineer with 6 years of experience in designing and implementing scalable data platforms and cloud-native solutions.
My expertise spans AWS and Azure, leveraging services such as S3, Glue, Redshift, Synapse, ADLS, Data Factory, and Databricks.
I specialize in building robust ETL/ELT pipelines using Apache Spark, Airflow, and Kafka, supporting both batch and real-time processing.
Proficient in data warehousing, data modeling, and governance, with hands-on experience in Snowflake, Redshift, and Azure Synapse.
Skilled in Python, SQL, and Scala, I also bring strong knowledge of CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform for modern data engineering practices.
Passionate about performance optimization and data-driven insights, while mentoring teams and collaborating across functions to achieve business goals.

description.text:
working as a Data Engineer at Capital one , where I designed and deployed cloud-native ETL pipelines using Apache Spark, Airflow, and Kafka, enabling scalable ingestion and transformation of financial and behavioral data.

Built data lake and warehouse solutions on AWS (S3, Glue, Redshift) and Snowflake, improving query performance and supporting enterprise BI reporting.

Developed real-time data streaming applications with Kafka and Kinesis, integrating with fraud detection systems for instant anomaly tracking.

Automated infrastructure provisioning using Terraform and CloudFormation, reducing manual effort and ensuring consistent, secure deployments.

Implemented data quality and governance frameworks (Great Expectations, IAM, KMS), ensuring compliance with SOX and HIPAA regulations.

Collaborated with cross-functional teams in Agile environments, mentoring junior engineers and driving best practices in data engineering.

Worked as a Data Engineer at Tenet Healthcare, where I designed and maintained scalable data warehousing solutions using AWS Redshift, Snowflake, and CloudFormation to optimize storage, automation, and analytics performance for large healthcare datasets.

 I built and orchestrated complex ETL/ELT pipelines with Apache Spark, Airflow, Kafka, and Flink, integrating data from EHR systems, HL7 interfaces, billing, and patient management platforms for real-time and batch processing.

I developed reusable Python, Scala, and Bash scripts along with Jenkins automation to streamline workflows, improve data quality, reduce latency, and increase reliability.

 I also implemented data governance frameworks with Apache Atlas and cataloging tools to ensure encryption, auditing, and compliance with HIPAA and GDPR standards.

My role involved writing optimized SQL/PLSQL queries, implementing dimensional/star schema modeling for analytics, and building validation frameworks with PyTest and Great Expectations to ensure data accuracy and completeness. 

I collaborated closely with analysts, data scientists, and stakeholders via JIRA and Confluence to deliver actionable insights, while contributing to Agile Scrum ceremonies for continuous product improvements. 

Additionally, I mentored junior engineers on AWS Glue, Redshift Spectrum, and Terraform, promoting best practices in data architecture, security, and automation

At Wayfair, I contributed to building scalable data platforms to support e-commerce analytics, supply chain optimization, and real-time operational insights. 

I designed star and snowflake schemas to improve analytical performance and developed robust ETL pipelines using Apache Airflow, Spark, and Python, ingesting data from internal APIs and external partner systems into Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS).

I architected and managed a data lake and enterprise-grade data warehouses with Azure Synapse Analytics, supporting downstream analytics, machine learning workflows, and BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, and Looker. 

I implemented real-time pipelines using Apache Kafka, Flink, and Beam, enabling low-latency tracking of user activity and operational dashboards.

Additionally, I enforced data governance, automated quality checks, and optimized query performance using Spark SQL, Hive, and Presto, while deploying and containerizing workloads with Azure Databricks, Docker, and Kubernetes. 

I also integrated DevOps practices (CI/CD, GitLab, Jenkins, Terraform) for pipeline automation and infrastructure management.

Collaborating closely with analysts, product owners, and engineers, I ensured data solutions aligned with business goals, and mentored junior engineers on big data tools, cloud architecture, and pipeline best practices.
2 experiences across Tenet Healthcare and 1 other company
2 experiences across Capital One and 1 other company

Master’s in Data Science with expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data-driven problem solving. Skilled in Python, SQL, and cloud technologies to extract actionable insights from complex datasets.

headline: Data Engineer | Cloud & Big Data | Apache Spark | Kafka | Snowflake | ETL & Streaming Pipelines | SQL | Python | Airflow | Databricks
about:
Data Engineer with 3+ years of experience building scalable data pipelines and cloud-native platforms on AWS and GCP. Proficient in Python, SQL, PySpark, and tools like Apache Spark, Kafka, Airflow, and Databricks.
Skilled in developing ETL/ELT workflows, real-time streaming systems, and optimizing data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery). Experienced in CI/CD automation, API integration, and deploying data apps with Docker and Kubernetes. Focused on delivering secure, high-performance data solutions to support analytics and ML use cases.

description.text:
•	Built and optimized ETL workflows using Python, Apache Airflow, and Apache Spark, making data pipelines 45% more efficient.
•	Built and maintained data pipelines on GCP (Dataproc, Kafka, BigQuery), improving data processing efficiency by 40%.
•	Automated ETL/ELT processes by implementing apache Airflow reducing manual effort by 50% and ensuring smooth, reliable data operations.
•	Developed real-time data streaming solutions by integrating Kafka with Apache Spark, ensuring faster access to critical business insights.
•	Streamlined BigQuery and Snowflake queries by implementing partitioning, clustering, and indexing, reducing query execution time by 35%.
•	Collaborated with cross-functional teams, including business intelligence and analytics, to define data models and governance policies.
•	Ensured security and compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, and SOC 2 regulations, implementing access controls and encryption for sensitive data.

•	Engineered high-performance data processing solutions using Java, optimizing computation speed and scalability for large datasets.
•	Managed and optimized NoSQL databases and relational databases to improve storage and retrieval performance.
•	Implemented real-time analytics pipelines with Google Cloud Dataflow, and Pub/Sub, enabling faster data-driven decision-making.
•	Built CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins automating deployment and monitoring, reducing manual intervention by 60% and improving deployment speed by 40%.
•	Integrated third-party APIs to automate external data collection, reducing response times by 30% and improving system connectivity.
•	Leveraged machine learning workflows to automate predictive modeling for business insights.
•	Conducted performance tuning and query optimization in Snowflake and BigQuery, reducing query execution times by 40%.
•	Used Kubernetes and Docker to deploy and scale data applications, making the system more flexible and efficient.

headline: Senior Data Engineer.Snowflake, pysaprk , python , spark , Airflow , SQL.With clouds AWS , Azure and GCP, Data Bricks , kafka, Data Migration .
about: Highly accomplished Senior Data Engineer with 10+ years of experience designing, developing, and optimizing large-scale data pipelines, cloud-based data platforms, and advanced analytics solutions across AWS, Azure, GCP, and hybrid environments. Proven expertise in big data ecosystems (Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Kafka, Hive, HBase), real-time streaming, and ETL/ELT processes using modern tools like Databricks, Informatica, Talend, Airflow, Glue, and Snowflake. Adept in architecting secure, high-performance, and cost-optimized data solutions, leading end-to-end cloud migrations, and implementing advanced analytics, including machine learning workflows with Spark MLlib and Scikit-learn. Strong programming proficiency in Python, Scala, SQL, and shell scripting, with deep knowledge of CI/CD automation, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Ansible). Recognized for delivering scalable, resilient, and business-driven data solutions that enable actionable insights and accelerate decision-making.

experiences.title: Sr Data Engineer
experiences.subtitle: EQ Bank | Equitable Bank · Contract Full-time
experiences.caption: Jul 2023 - Present · 2 yrs 4 mos

description.text:
As a Senior Data Engineer at EQ Bank, I led the design, development, and deployment of robust, scalable, and real-time data pipelines using a wide array of modern cloud, big data, and streaming technologies. My role involved working across cross-functional teams to drive high-quality, production-ready solutions that powered analytics, business intelligence, and real-time insights.

🔹 Key Responsibilities:
Data Pipeline Development: Designed and implemented AWS-based ETL and ELT pipelines using Lambda, API Gateway, S3, DynamoDB, and Snowflake for seamless data ingestion and transformation workflows.

Big Data Processing: Deployed and managed AWS EMR clusters to process large-scale datasets using Apache Spark, Hive, and Hadoop, enabling high-performance distributed computing.

Spark & PySpark Expertise: Built complex batch and streaming applications using PySpark and Scala, leveraging in-memory processing for efficient data transformations, aggregations, and ML model execution.

Streaming & Real-time Processing: Developed real-time streaming applications using Apache Flink, Kafka, and Spark Streaming, enabling near-instant insights from high-velocity data sources.

Data Integration & Transformation: Utilized Talend Open Studio for batch ETL, with advanced use of tMap, tJoin, tAggregate, etc., and created API-based connectors for dynamic data access.

Workflow Orchestration: Implemented and optimized Apache Airflow for workflow orchestration, ensuring reliability, scalability, and monitoring of data pipelines.

BigQuery Optimization: Built real-time streaming pipelines and governed BigQuery datasets by implementing partitioning, clustering, and query optimization, leading to improved performance and reduced costs.

Cloud & Infrastructure Engineering: Managed CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure provisioning with Terraform, and automated deployments using Git, Ansible, Prometheus, Grafana, and Kubernetes monitoring.

As a Senior Data Engineer at TD Bank, I architected and developed robust, enterprise-grade data platforms and real-time analytics solutions by leveraging cloud-native services, big data frameworks, and advanced data engineering tools. My role encompassed building scalable data pipelines, integrating structured and unstructured data, enabling advanced analytics, and ensuring high data quality and compliance in a regulated financial environment.

🔹 Key Responsibilities:
Cloud Data Architecture (Azure & AWS):

Architected large-scale data engineering solutions using Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Synapse, Databricks, and HDInsight.

Automated ETL/ELT data pipelines across Azure, AWS, and on-prem sources using Informatica PowerCenter/MDM, ADF, and Apache Airflow.

Migrated on-prem databases to Azure Data Lake Store and Azure SQL DW, using ADF, Informatica, and custom Shell scripts.

As a Data Engineer at UST global
Designed and maintained logical and physical data models for Snowflake; evaluated schema changes to ensure scalability and performance.

Migrated legacy on-premises applications to AWS, utilizing EC2 and S3 for compute and storage, and managed distributed processing workloads using Hadoop clusters on AWS EMR.

Developed and deployed infrastructure-as-code using Terraform and AWS CloudFormation to automate provisioning of AWS services including ELB, CloudFront, RDS, EC2, VPC, Route 53, S3, and Lambda.

Built and managed data lakes and data catalogs on AWS Glue; integrated AWS services such as S3, Lambda, and Glue to support end-to-end data pipelines.

Developed scalable data processing pipelines using AWS EMR, implementing performance optimizations like partitioning, caching, and fine-tuned resource configurations.

Created Athena-based data models from S3 buckets and visualized data using AWS QuickSight for reporting and analytics.

Used Git for version control and Jenkins for CI/CD automation; integrated with Jira for change tracking and project visibility.

Built batch and streaming data pipelines using Snowpipe and Matillion to ingest data from AWS S3 into Snowflake for transformation and analysis.

Hands-on experience with a wide range of big data tools: Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Kafka, Oozie, Flume, HBase, Zeppelin, Apache Pig, and Apache Flink.

Worked on Redshift and Snowflake-based data warehouses; performed complex SQL development (DDL, DML), stored procedures, and views to support business intelligence requirements.

Designed and implemented robust data pipelines and ETL workflows in Azure Data Factory v2 to integrate data from diverse sources into Azure Data Lake and Synapse Analytics. Developed batch and streaming pipelines using Azure Databricks, Spark, Delta Tables, ADLS Gen2, and Event Hub to process large-scale structured and unstructured data. Leveraged Hive, Hadoop, Python, PySpark, and MapReduce for advanced analytics, trend detection, and business insights.

As a Data Engineer at Teleperformance, I was responsible for migrating and transforming legacy data from on-premises SQL Server and Teradata systems into modern cloud-based data lakes and warehouses using AWS and Snowflake. I designed and optimized data pipelines leveraging Apache Spark, AWS EMR, and Snowflake to ensure efficient data ingestion, processing, and storage. My role involved enhancing data quality through rigorous validation and testing, developing predictive analytics models using Python, and creating insightful dashboards for business stakeholders. Additionally, I implemented automated workflows and monitoring systems to support reliable and scalable ETL processes, contributing to improved data-driven decision-making across marketing and operational teams.

headline: Airflow | Spark | Docker | Openshift | Kubernetes | Kafka | Snowflake | Data Engineering | DevOps | AI Agents | Gen AI | Full Stack Developer | MERN | MEAN | Prompt Engineering | Learning AI |
about:
Experienced data and DevOps engineer skilled in building scalable data pipelines and microservices, with a strong record of modernizing legacy workflows using Apache Airflow, Spark, and Kafka. Demonstrated ability to deploy robust solutions on OpenShift and Kubernetes, automate CI/CD with Tekton and GitHub Actions, and develop secure Angular applications with Python Flask and OKTA, adding advanced capabilities like spark and Kafla to data engineering projects. Consistently reduced data processing times by over 90% and improved deployment efficiency. Knowledgeable in AI agents development,  Generative AI, LLMs, Langraph, and Langchain. Seeking to deliver impactful, next-generation solutions leveraging cutting-edge tools.

As a Technical Content Writer, I share insights on Python, DevOps, and MERN stack through articles on Geeks for Geeks, reaching thousands of readers. I won the Best Paper Award at the 10th International Conference on Contemporary Engineering and Technology 2022 for my Bluetooth mesh messaging research. A 2023 B.Tech graduate in Computer Science from Sree Vidyanikethan Engineering College, I hold 5-star HackerRank certifications in Java, Python, and Problem Solving, and I’m pursuing Azure Data Engineering certifications (DP-900, DP-203) to advance my expertise.

I’m passionate about solving complex challenges and collaborating with stakeholders to deliver scalable solutions. My strong problem-solving skills drive innovative data engineering and DevOps outcomes. Outside work, I enjoy exploring tech trends and refining my craft. Let’s connect to create impactful solutions together!

description.text:
🚀 Deployed Airflow application using Helm Charts, ArgoCD, and OpenShift; migrated legacy SSIS jobs to Airflow DAGs with Python and Spark, slashing job execution time from 2 hours to 20 minutes.
✨ Implemented Apache Kafka with Streams for Apache Kafka on OpenShift; migrated jobs to Kafka streaming with producer-consumer architecture, boosting upstream and downstream job efficiency.
⚡️ Hosted standalone Spark on OpenShift via Helm Charts, enabling autoscaling and dynamic execution; cut Airflow job times from 20 minutes to 2 minutes, achieving a 2-hour-to-2-minute reduction.
🔄 Developed Tekton Pipelines for CI/CD automation, streamlining Bitbucket repository deployments and enhancing development efficiency.
🌐 Deployed GitHub Actions Pipelines for CI/CD, enabling seamless, automated deployments for GitHub repositories.
🔒 Built a full-stack Angular app with Python backend, deployed as a microservice on OpenShift with OKTA authentication, ensuring secure, scalable functionality.
Successfully completed Aws Data Analytics Virtual Internship

headline: Senior Data Engineer | Snowflake, AWS & Microsoft Certified |Python | Apache Spark | Hadoop | Databricks | AWS | Azure | Kafka | Dockers & Kubernetes | Airflow | Open to Relocation | Actively Seeking Contract roles
topSkillsByEndorsements: Large Language Models (LLM), Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure Cloud, Apache Spark Streaming, apache cassandra
about:
I’m a Senior Data Engineer with 12 years of experience designing and delivering scalable big data and cloud-based solutions. My expertise spans the Hadoop ecosystem including Spark, Hive, MapReduce, Pig, HDFS, and YARN as well as NoSQL databases like HBase and Cassandra. I specialize in building robust ETL pipelines, real-time streaming applications, and data lake architectures using PySpark, Kafka, and Apache NiFi.

I have hands-on experience with AWS (EMR, S3, EC2, DynamoDB, CloudFormation) and Azure (Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake, Blob Storage), and have led multiple cloud migration and modernization initiatives. I’m also highly skilled in Snowflake, SQL, and data modeling, with a strong focus on performance optimization and governance.

My background includes developing machine learning models using Python (Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy) and visualizing insights through Power BI and Tableau. I bring DevOps experience with Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, and Autosys, and I’m adept at automating workflows and managing distributed systems.

I’m passionate about transforming raw data into actionable insights and thrive at the intersection of data engineering, cloud architecture, and AI-driven analytics. Whether it’s building real-time data platforms or optimizing legacy systems, I bring a strategic mindset and hands-on expertise to every project.

experiences.title: Senior Data Engineer
experiences.subtitle: Bank of America · Contract
experiences.caption: Feb 2022 - Present · 3 yrs 9 mos
experiences.metadata: Charlotte, North Carolina, United States · Remote

description.text: At Bank of America, I led end-to-end data engineering and system modernization initiatives across financial research and mortgage domains, driving scalable, high-performance solutions using Agile methodologies. I modernized multiple legacy applications by migrating from .NET Framework 4.8 to .NET 8 with WinUI3, updated Windows Forms, and Web API frameworks, significantly improving maintainability and performance. I designed low-latency backend services using gRPC and Windows Service APIs to enable scalable, decoupled data pipelines, and integrated Orbbec Camera with Azure Body Tracking SDK for real-time ingestion and biomechanical analytics. Leveraging Databricks and Delta Lake, I implemented ACID transactions, schema evolution, and time travel capabilities, optimized data lake performance through partitioning strategies and Unity Catalog governance, and enabled real-time ingestion using Kafka and Kinesis. I developed and orchestrated ETL workflows with Python, DBT, Azure Data Factory, OneLake, and Fabric Data Warehouse, authored detailed technical documentation, and architected containerized microservices with Azure Container Apps, achieving a 10x improvement in response times. Additionally, I implemented CI/CD pipelines with container orchestration, ensuring faster, more reliable deployments.

experiences.title: Senior Data Engineer
experiences.subtitle: Merck · Contract
experiences.caption: Dec 2019 - Jan 2022 · 2 yrs 2 mos
experiences.metadata: Lebanon, New Jersey, United States · Remote

description.text: Led the strategic migration of 8TB from on-prem Hadoop/Oracle to Snowflake, leveraging Snowpipe and SnowSQL for seamless ingestion. Architected consumer-driven data zones and optimized ELT workflows using Airflow and Snowflake Python Connector, accelerating reporting by 40%. Strengthened governance through network policies, secure views, dynamic masking, and lineage tracking with QUERY_TAGS. Tuned complex SQL transformations and built GitLab CI pipelines to enforce code quality and speed delivery. Architected scalable multi-cluster warehouses with sub-second query performance. Delivered workshops and training to promote self-service analytics. Developed machine learning solutions with Scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas, and visualization tools. Engineered big data solutions on Hortonworks, Spark, and Hive automating delta feeds via Sqoop and enabling real-time Kafka + Spark Streaming pipelines in Scala. Designed Snowflake data models and orchestrated Spark-based transformations on AWS EMR, EC2, S3, and Redshift. Extracted data via REST APIs and built multi-format ingestion workflows with Flume, Pig, MapReduce, and Hive. Used Kubernetes and Docker for CI/CD, and delivered SQL-based insights via Power BI. Strong focus on scalable architectures, pipeline automation, and secure data governance across financial and enterprise-grade environments.

At AT&T, I served as a Data Engineer on the mission-critical Billing & Payments platform, responsible for the end-to-end architecture and delivery of all billing and payment data workflows. I began by automating delta feeds from Oracle (via Sqoop) and FTP servers into HDFS, then designed Hive schemas including complex data types and wrote HQL queries to support both batch reporting and ad-hoc analytics. To enable real-time processing of payment events, I built Spark Streaming jobs in Scala that consumed Kafka topics, applied business-rule transformations, and persisted results to HBase for low-latency lookups and to Snowflake for downstream analytics 

On the batch side, I developed PySpark applications on AWS EMR to process large datasets converting Python forecasting models to Spark for scalable execution and orchestrated these jobs using Oozie workflows. I leveraged AWS services (EC2, S3, EMR, RDS, Redshift, Data Pipeline) to host clusters, store raw and processed data, and schedule complex ETL pipelines, while also creating Python scripts to pull data from REST APIs into S3 

To ensure CI/CD and operational resilience, I containerized Spark and other data services with Docker and Kubernetes, integrated version control via Git, and monitored cluster health and job performance through CloudWatch and custom logging. I Implemented rigorous data-quality checks in Snowflake using SnowSQL, developed stored procedures, CTEs, and UDFs to validate financial records, and built Power BI dashboards to surface key metrics guaranteeing accuracy and integrity across the entire billing lifecycle

At Concentrix I led the end-to-end engineering of a high-performance data backbone for an online education marketplace. I began by importing heterogeneous data from Oracle databases, FTP feeds and third-party systems into HDFS using Sqoop and custom shell scripts, then applied complex MapReduce and Hive transformations to standardize, enrich and partition the data for efficient querying 
To enforce critical business rules such as validating tutor availability, course prerequisites and enrollment windows, I developed Java UDFs embedded in I Hive jobs, ensuring only compliant records flowed downstream. I also built SnowSQL-powered analytical warehouses in Snowflake to perform proactive data-quality analyses, rapidly surfacing anomalies in stock levels, user profiles and scheduling data 
Throughout the engagement, I optimized query performance by refining Hive schemas and MapReduce job configurations, and worked closely with analytics and BI teams to make this cleansed, rule-driven data available for reporting and dashboards.

At Perceptive Analytics, I served as a Hadoop Developer on a supply-chain optimization platform for a major manufacturing client. The core objective was to ingest, process, and analyze data from suppliers, production facilities, distribution centers, and retailers to drive smarter inventory management, improve demand-forecast accuracy, and streamline logistics planning. I built batch pipelines using Sqoop to import Teradata and Oracle data into HDFS, then applied MapReduce and Hive transformations—augmented with custom Python and PySpark scripts to cleanse, enrich, and partition the data. Workflows were orchestrated via Oozie, while real-time feeds were handled through Kafka and Spark Streaming, with results persisted to Cassandra for low-latency lookups and to EDW tables for downstream analytics. I also implemented data-quality checks and imputation routines, developed interactive dashboards in Tableau, and enabled BI and machine-learning initiatives ultimately reducing stock-out risks and holding costs while boosting forecasting reliability

updates.postText:
Excited to share that I have successfully completed the Snowflake  SnowPro Core Certification!

This milestone has strengthened my expertise in cloud data warehousing, performance optimization, data sharing, and secure data management on Snowflake.

I’m looking forward to applying these skills to build scalable, efficient, and impactful data solutions.

#Snowflake #SnowProCore #Certification #DataEngineering #CloudComputing #ContinuousLearning

Interview Journey –  Data Engineer Role for STARBUCKS (via Randstad)
I recently completed a multi-stage interview process for a Azure Data Engineer position supporting Starbucks' mid-layer services and customer data initiatives. While the role was ultimately filled before the final client round, I’m proud of the alignment and progress throughout.

Here’s a quick breakdown of the journey:

Round 1: Glider Assessment A technical screening focused on Python, PySpark, Databricks, cloud architecture, and containerization. It validated core engineering skills and real-world problem-solving.

Round 2: Technical Interview A deep dive with the engineering team into my experience with scalable data pipelines, Kubernetes/Docker, automated testing, and agile delivery. We discussed past projects involving Snowflake optimization, real-time ingestion, and governance frameworks.

Final Round: Client Interview (Scheduled but Role Filled). Before the final client conversation could take place, I was informed that the position had been filled. While the timing didn’t align, the process reaffirmed my technical fit and communication strengths in enterprise data environments.
Thanks to the Randstad team for the smooth coordination and to the Starbucks team for the opportunity to engage. I remain open to new challenges, especially those involving Snowflake, PySpark, cloud-native platforms, and strategic data engineering.

If you're hiring for similar roles, I’d be glad to connect.

#DataEngineering #CloudPlatforms #PySpark #Databricks #Snowflake #TechLeadership #AgileDelivery #OpenToWork

Snowflake Data Engineer Interview Experience.
Recently, I sat down with a senior architect during a Snowflake Data Engineer interview. What started as a technical Q&A turned into a masterclass in strategic transformation. His company was moving away from Databricks-not just for speed, but to realign technology with people, process, and purpose.
He described it best: "This isn’t just a platform swap. We’re reshaping how our teams collaborate and how costs are controlled, while speeding up delivery across the board."
Here’s what stood out:
⚙️ Pipeline Complexity vs Speed to Insight Legacy Scala pipelines and Spark notebooks were powerful but required constant tuning and DevOps overhead. Snowflake’s SQL-first, managed compute simplified orchestration. Analysts explored directly, engineers optimized, and value arrived faster.
💸 Predictable Cost Governance Databricks’ DBU spikes made budgeting a guessing game. Snowflake’s credit-based pricing, auto-suspend, and resource monitors enabled precise forecasting and spend control finance and engineering aligned effortlessly.
🔁 Streaming, Reimagined Shifting from Spark Structured Streaming to Snowflake Streams & Tasks retained real-time capability but made orchestration cleaner and dashboards more dependable.
🧑‍🤝‍🧑 Broad Team Enablement A unified workspace empowered SQL analysts, Python devs, and data scientists to collaborate seamlessly. No one was blocked by deep Spark internals everyone contributed at speed.
🔌 Integrated Ecosystem With dbt, Airflow, and Tableau plugged in, the team streamlined transformations, testing, and documentation. What was siloed is now agile.
🤖 AI Innovation Front and Center Snowflake’s AI suite from Summit 2025 is a game-changer:
Snowflake Intelligence: Query data using natural language across structured and unstructured sources.
Cortex Agents: Build GenAI apps using SQL and LLMs.
AISQL: Analyze multimodel data text, images, audio with familiar SQL syntax.
Data Science Agent: Verified, automated ML pipelines powered by Claude.
AI Governance Gateway: Manage access, usage, and costs for AI workloads.
🎯 Takeaway This wasn’t just a tech migration it was a cultural one. From cost control to cross-functional collaboration, Snowflake is more than a tool. It’s a catalyst for business clarity and innovation. But no offense to databricks as I have worked for years with the tool and this post is the perspective of the company I interviewed not mine 
#Databricks #Snowflake #DataEngineering #CloudComputing #ETL #BigData #Dataengineering #DigitalTransformation #CloudBattle #BuiltDifferent

Walgreen Interview Experience 

I recently completed a multi-round interview for a Sr Data Engineer role at Walgreens that aligned perfectly with my technical background and business-facing experience.

Here’s how the process unfolded:

Round 1 – Recruiter/HR Screening: Shared my background, career aspirations, and how my data engineering experience mapped to Walgreens’ goals.

Round 2 – Technical Deep Dive: Discussed cloud-native architectures, ETL pipelines, real-time vs batch workflows, and Python coding challenges.

Round 3 – Case Study & Business Alignment: Explored scaling data systems, ensuring data quality, and translating technical solutions into business impact.
Consistent strong feedback through each stage.

I was preparing for the final panel round expected to focus on system design, leadership, and behavioral discussions, when the client unexpectedly froze the role due to internal restructuring and budget shifts.

Disappointing? Yes.
Out of my control? Absolutely.
A setback? Only on paper.

I’m continuing to engage with opportunities that value technical leadership, strategic alignment, and long-term impact. Every conversation sharpens my narrative. Every interaction expands my network. And every challenge strengthens my resolve.

If you’re building a team that needs a data engineer who can bridge technology and business, I’d welcome the chance to connect.

#DataEngineering #CloudArchitecture #ETL #Python #CareerGrowth #Resilience #OpenToWork #TechLeadership #LinkedInNetworking #AWS #GoogleCloud #Microsoft

projects.title: Real-Time U.S. Airline Data Pipeline on AWS
projects.subtitle: Mar 2025 - May 2025

description.text:
This project implements a fully automated, production-grade ETL pipeline for ingesting, transforming, and visualizing U.S. airline data using AWS services including S3, Glue, Lambda, Athena, and QuickSight.

🧩 Key Components:

Amazon S3 for raw & processed data storage

AWS Glue Crawler + PySpark ETL Job to catalog and clean 100K+ records

Amazon Lambda auto-triggers ETL on new data uploads

Amazon Athena enables scalable SQL analysis on Parquet data

Amazon QuickSight delivers interactive dashboards for route insights, geo-mapping, and flight patterns

🛡️ Included:

Fine-grained IAM policies and roles

Automated schema detection & transformation

Visuals like longest routes, busiest city pairs, heatmaps, and geolocation maps

🔧 Tech Used: Python (PySpark), AWS Glue, S3, Lambda, Athena, QuickSight, IAM, CloudWatch
Dashboard + architecture diagram + full code are live on GitHub!

projects.title: Credit Card Transactions Predictive Analytics Pipeline on GCP
projects.subtitle: Feb 2025 - Apr 2025

description.text:
This project builds a Predictive Analytics Pipeline for Credit Card Transactions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The system detects fraudulent transactions, performs churn prediction, and enables anomaly detection alerts using BigQuery ML, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, and Looker Studio.

#📂 Architecture

Google Cloud Storage (GCS) – Stores raw transaction data.

Cloud Dataflow (Apache Beam) – Processes and cleans transaction data.

BigQuery & BigQuery ML – Trains fraud detection and churn prediction models.

Cloud Functions & Cloud Pub/Sub – Handles real-time anomaly detection and alerting.

Cloud Run – Deploys predictive APIs.

Looker Studio – Visualizes transaction insights.
This project builds a Predictive Analytics Pipeline for Credit Card Transactions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The system detects fraudulent transactions, performs churn prediction, and enables anomaly detection alerts using BigQuery ML, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, and Looker Studio. #📂 Architecture Google Cloud Storage (GCS) – Stores raw transaction data. Cloud Dataflow (Apache Beam) – Processes and cleans transaction data. BigQuery & BigQuery ML – Trains fraud detection and churn prediction models. Cloud Functions & Cloud Pub/Sub – Handles real-time anomaly detection and alerting. Cloud Run – Deploys predictive APIs. Looker Studio – Visualizes transaction insights.
